item.title: Specialized Packing
item.dc:creator: Austin Moving Forward
item.content:encoded:
[et_pb_section][et_pb_row][et_pb_column type="2_3"][et_pb_text admin_label="Text" background_layout="light" text_orientation="left"]

Specialized Packing

We takeÂ extra care to make sure all items are loaded, unloaded and delivered without any damage. Our team of packing and moving experts can safely wrap any item big or small and properly prepare it for moving.Â Â Every piece of furniture is wrapped and padded.Â We take extra measures to protect your floor, doorways and walls when moving items in and out of your location. We roll out protective carpet and cardboard as well as protective shoe covers to prevent scuffs and scratches to your floor. This also prevents dirt from being tracked in while our movers are coming in and out. This is just another way we make your move easier and less stressful. From time to time we move specialty items that require additional crating. Our movers are experienced and ready to handle these situations. We will build custom crates for your large fragile items before we arrive. The crates are lined with Styrofoam sheets that are measured, cut to size and then taped in place. After that the item is wrapped and placed into the custom built crate. item.dc:creator: Austin Moving Forward
item.content:encoded:
[et_pb_section admin_label="section"][et_pb_row admin_label="row"][et_pb_column type="4_4"][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row admin_label="row"][et_pb_column type="4_4"][et_pb_text admin_label="Text" background_layout="light" text_orientation="left" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid"]

Storage

WE PROVIDE:
  • 24-hour video surveillance
  • State-of-the-art alarm system
  • Itemized inventory
  • Professional and experienced movers
  • Fire proof and fully insulated facilities
  • Pro-rated pricing
Austin Moving Forward has a secure, state-of-the-art Storage Facility for storage for your residential or commercial moves. Our facilities take advantage of the latest technology to provide assurance, night and day, so that you don't have to worry. Things like art, antiques, books and documents receive special handling so they will last in storage.
When you are ready for your goods to be delivered, simply call our office and we will set up a speedy delivery. Our professional movers will unload all items in your home or office and take back any gently used boxes. We will also take any recyclable materials from you so that you are not burdened with extra clutter in your new place! After all, we want you to resume your everyday activities after your residential or commercial moves as soon as possible. One Month FREE Storage

Austin Movers offering Affordable, Fast, Friendly Austin Moving Service

Welcome to Austin Moving Forward, a top rated Austin moving company offering eco friendly moving solutions.!  We believe that is it possible to combine first class service with the utmost sincerity, and can do it all at affordable prices, without harming the environment. If you are looking for Austin Movers, then you should strongly consider giving Austin Moving Forward a call. Our prices are unmatched against many of the other Austin Moving Companies and our Moving Service is second to none. Specialized Packing

  We take extra care to make sure all items are loaded, unloaded and delivered without any damage. Our team of packing and moving experts can safely wrap any item big or small and properly prepare it for moving.  Every piece of furniture is wrapped and padded.  We take extra measures to protect your floor, doorways and walls when moving items in and out of your location. We roll out protective carpet and cardboard as well as protective shoe covers to prevent scuffs and scratches to your floor. Our movers are experienced and ready to handle to move specialty items that require additional crating including building custom crates.   [/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row admin_label="row"][et_pb_column type="1_2"][et_pb_text admin_label="Text" background_layout="light" text_orientation="left"]   Custom Crate:
  • Best possible way to ship your priceless items.
  • Built specifically for you, based on the exact dimensions of your items.
  • Highest level of protection and the crate is yours to keep for future moves.
  • The typical cost for crating starts at about $100. Understandably, that might deter some from choosing that option, but it's far less expensive than replacing your priceless antique.
  • Bottom line is this, ask questions about your specialty items before your move and we'll make sure to guide you in the right direction.
To understand more about the pros and cons of custom crate vs. traditional package for specialty items, see our blog "Custom Crating vs. Traditional Packing". Moving Supplies

Here at Austin MovingÂ  Forward we work hard to provide you with excellent, convenient service. You may need moving supplies in preparation for your move. Call 512-201-4777Â for rates and to schedule a box pickup or delivery today!

Do You Need Moving Supplies?

Box Buy-Back Program

Austin Moving Â Forward strives to be as eco-friendly as possible. This is why we offer a friendly service called our Box Buy-Back Program. You leave us a deposit in the amount of the cost of the boxes. This deposit is refundable at half the cost of what you paid, so long as we get the boxes back in re-usable condition within two weeks after your delivery date. You can keep as many as you like, but you wonâ€™t get money back for the ones you keep.

After you unpack the boxes they must be returned to our location during business hours, folded flat. We then re-use those boxes! Eventually, when the boxes are no longer usable, we recycle them.

The Box Buy Back Program is for customers in the Austin Metro area only.Â

item.title: Moving Tips
item.dc:creator: Austin Moving Forward
item.content:encoded:
[et_pb_section admin_label="section"][et_pb_row admin_label="row"][et_pb_column type="4_4"][et_pb_text admin_label="Text" background_layout="light" text_orientation="left" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid"]

Moving Tips

Who can't use some moving tips when they're packing up their whole life for a new home? If you're among thousands of people who have picked up and moved their family to a new home or a new community, you have fresh memories of some of the ups and downs or thrills or frustrations of residential moving. Drawing from personal experience, I know there are lots of ways to help make your household move easier. Read here for help to get your life, and your possessions, organized for a peaceful and exciting residential move.   [caption id="attachment_459" align="alignright" width="500"] You'll need LOTS of boxes - probably more boxes than you think, and having enough boxes will make your life easier![/caption] Make a list. Write everything down! You'll thank yourself later. Before you pack even one box, create a simple record keeping system. Create a computer-printed list of numbers with a space to write the contents. Or have a spiral-bound notebook for the job. You'll place a number on EVERY box you pack and list the contents on your list. Don't put the list down unless it's in a place you'll call Packing Central. This is where you'll find your labels, marking pens, box tape, and other supplies. When describing the box contents, be specific — “A-D files” is better than “files”, and “Tulip dishes” rather than “misc. kitchen”. Have plenty of supplies. Don’t make me say this twice– you’ll need LOTS of boxes–probably more boxes than you think, and having enough boxes will make your life easier! (If you buy your boxes from a moving company, you can always return unused boxes for a refund. If you got them free from the grocery, just toss any leftovers.) Have about 10 boxes set aside to use for last minute items on moving day, such as bedding, clothing, and cleaning supplies. You’ll need strong plastic packing tape to close up the boxes securely. Use unprinted newsprint (newspaper can stain your items) or packing paper or bubble wrap to wrap and cushion household good. Again, you’ll need lots more supplies than you think, so get extra so the packing can go smoothly. Return any unused supplies after the truck is packed. Utilize wardrobe boxes. These tall boxes are perfect for bulky, lightweight items such as comforters, pillows, and blankets, as well as clothes that need to remain hanging. Call your mover to ask the width of the wardrobe boxes they’ll be bringing. Then measure the clothes in your closets (including coat closets) to see how many wardrobe boxes you’ll need. You can also use them for closet storage boxes, shoe boxes, and other bulky items such as fabric bolts, large baskets, or gift wrap tubes. Don’t make the boxes too heavy to lift, however. One mover told the story of someone who put a bowling ball in a wardrobe box! When the box was lifted off the truck the bottom gave way, sending the bowling ball on a wild ride down the ramp, across the street to the gutter, then down a hill where it finally came to rest in a roadside ditch. (Is that a strike or a spare?) Strategize wardrobe box use. Residential moving companies will be happy to deliver boxes ahead of your moving day. Or if you’re doing the move yourself, get things organized as early as possible. A few days before your move, fill some sturdy handled shopping bags with bulky closet items such as shoes, sweaters, belts, and jeans. On moving day, fill the bottom of the wardrobe boxes with some of the shopping bags, then add your hanging clothing. Pack hanging items tightly so things won’t move around and fall off of hangers. Finally, cover the shoulders of your clothes (a dry cleaning bag works well), then add a few purses or sweaters on top. You’ll have fewer boxes, and closet items remain together. Also, the shopping bags will make it easier to retrieve your belongings from the bottoms of a tall wardrobe box. Color coordinate. Designate a color for each room in the new home, such as yellow for kitchen, orange for dining room, etc. Apply colored stickers on the box near the box number. In your new home. Put a matching sticker on the door to each room. The movers will know where to put everything when they arrive at the destination. It’s also helpful to post a big sign on the wall in the room where you want boxes stacked, (“Boxes here please“) to keep them out of furniture and traffic areas. Keep things together. Insist on keeping things together when you or the movers are packing boxes. Keep bookends with books, light bulbs with lamps, and extension cords with appliances. Small, loose parts can be attached to the item they belong to with tape or placed in small envelopes — to keep picture hooks with pictures, shelf brackets with a bookcase, a special wrench and bolts with the wall unit. Keep larger corresponding items (such as a cable TV cord) in resealable bags, and tape these to the underside or back of the item. As a backup, have a “Parts Box” open on the kitchen counter and fill it with cables, cords, parts, pieces, brackets, or nails that are removed from any items of furniture. Keep this box with you, or mark it well with a rainbow of colored stickers so it can be easily located on move-in day. [caption id="attachment_460" align="alignleft" width="500"] Anything you can pack ahead will save you time on moving day.[/caption] Pack ahead. Anything you can pack ahead will save you time on moving day. If it’s summer, get your winter clothes out of the way. You don’t really need 5 radios or TV’s around your house for the last few days there. Box up your shampoo and extra toothpaste and live out of a travel cosmetic case for the last week or two. Pare down cooking utensils and food supplies to bare essentials. Wastebaskets can also be packed (put things in them!) while you switch to using plastic grocery bags (hang them on a cabinet door or door handle to collect trash.) Consolidate cleaning supplies. If you must clean your old place after moving out, put together a kit of basic cleaning supplies and rags. Clean anything possible ahead of time (the inside of kitchen cupboards, the oven, windows, etc.), and if possible, vacuum each room as movers empty it. Use your luggage. Fill luggage and duffle bags with clothing, sheets, towels, and paper goods. Even for local residential moving you’ll be able to quickly spot your navy suitcase holding your favorite sweaters, whereas “Box #189″ might remain elusive for days. Safeguard valued items. It’s a good idea to keep valuable possessions, such as silverware, collections, or antiques, with you. If you have a long move and no room in your car, bury the items in a box titled “Misc. from kitchen pantry”. Either way, check your homeowner’s insurance to see how you are covered during the move, and if you need additional insurance from the mover. Also, find out what paperwork (receipts, appraisals, and photos) you might need to file a claim in case of loss. Keep important papers with you. Your list of “important” papers might include : birth certificates, school records, mover estimates, new job contacts, utility company numbers, recent bank records, current bills, phone lists, closing papers, realtor info, maps, and more. Don’t leave these with the mover. Keep them with you! Personal boxes. Use brightly colored storage tote boxes, one for each person. Let each family member fill theirs with items they’ll want ‘right away’ in the new home — a set of sheets, a towel, a couple of extension cords, a phone, nightlights, address book, pens and paper, keys, kleenex, and travel cosmetic case, and so on. Residential moving may not be the most fun you’ve ever had, but planning ahead will go a long way toward making the process bearable. wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
Moving Tips

Who canâ€™t use some moving tips when theyâ€™reÂ packingÂ up their whole life for a new home? If youâ€™re among thousands of people who have picked up and moved their family to a new home or a new community, you have fresh memories of some of the ups and downs or thrills or frustrations of moving.

Drawing from personal experience, I know there are lots of ways to help make your household move easier. Read here for help to get your life, and your possessions, organized for a peaceful and exciting move.

Make a list.
Write everything down! Youâ€™ll thank yourself later. Before you pack even oneÂ box, create a simple record keeping system. Create a computer-printed list of numbers with a space to write the contents. Or have a spiral-bound notebook for the job. Youâ€™ll place a number on EVERY box you pack and list the contents on your list. Donâ€™t put the list down unless itâ€™s in a place youâ€™ll callÂ Packing Central.Â This is where youâ€™ll find your labels, marking pens, box tape, and other supplies. When describing the box contents, be specific â€” â€œA-D filesâ€ is better than â€œfilesâ€, and â€œTulip dishesâ€ rather than â€œmisc. kitchenâ€.

Have plenty of supplies.
Donâ€™t make me say this twiceâ€“ youâ€™ll need LOTS of boxesâ€“probably more boxes than you think, and having enough boxes will make your life easier! (If you buy your boxes from aÂ moving company, you can always return unused boxes for a refund. If you got them free from the grocery, just toss any leftovers.) Have about 10 boxes set aside to use for last minute items on moving day, such as bedding, clothing, and cleaning supplies. Youâ€™ll needÂ strong plastic packingÂ tape to close up the boxes securely. Use unprinted newsprint (newspaper can stain your items) or packing paper or bubble wrap to wrap and cushion household good. Again, youâ€™ll need lots more supplies than you think, so get extra so the packing can go smoothly. Return any unused supplies after the truck is packed.

Utilize wardrobe boxes.
These tall boxes are perfect for bulky, lightweight items such as comforters, pillows, and blankets, as well as clothes that need to remain hanging. Call your mover to ask the width of the wardrobe boxes theyâ€™ll be bringing. Then measure the clothes in your closets (including coat closets) to see how many wardrobe boxes youâ€™ll need. You can also use them for closet storage boxes, shoe boxes, and other bulky items such as fabric bolts, large baskets, or gift wrap tubes.

Donâ€™t make the boxes too heavy to lift, however. One mover told the story of someone who put a bowling ball in a wardrobe box! When the box was lifted off the truck the bottom gave way, sending the bowling ball on a wild ride down the ramp, across the street to the gutter, then down a hill where it finally came to rest in a roadside ditch. (Is that a strike or a spare?)

Strategize wardrobe box use.
Moving companiesÂ will be happy to deliver boxes ahead of your moving day. Or if youâ€™re doing the move yourself, get things organized as early as possible. A few days before your move, fill some sturdy handled shopping bags with bulky closet items such as shoes, sweaters, belts, and jeans. On moving day, fill the bottom of the wardrobe boxes with some of the shopping bags, then add your hanging clothing. Pack hanging items tightly so things wonâ€™t move around and fall off of hangers. Finally, cover the shoulders of your clothes (a dry cleaning bag works well), then add a few purses or sweaters on top. Youâ€™ll have fewer boxes, and closet items remain together. Also, the shopping bags will make it easier to retrieve your belongings from the bottoms of a tall wardrobe box.

Color coordinate.
Designate aÂ colorÂ for each room in the new home, such as yellow for kitchen, orange for dining room, etc. Apply colored stickers on the box near the box number. In your new home. Put a matching sticker on the door to each room. The movers will know where to put everything when they arrive at the destination. Itâ€™s also helpful to post a big sign on the wall in the room where you want boxes stacked, (â€œBoxes here pleaseâ€œ) to keep them out of furniture and traffic areas.

Keep things together.
Insist on keeping things together when you or the movers are packing boxes. Keep bookends with books, light bulbs with lamps, and extension cords with appliances. Small, loose parts can be attached to the item they belong to with tape or placed in small envelopes â€” to keep picture hooks with pictures, shelf brackets with a bookcase, a special wrench and bolts with the wall unit. Keep larger corresponding items (such as a cable TV cord) in resealable bags, and tape these to the underside or back of the item. As a backup, have a â€œParts Boxâ€ open on the kitchen counter and fill it with cables, cords, parts, pieces, brackets, or nails that are removed from any items of furniture. Keep this box with you, or mark it well with a rainbow of colored stickers so it can be easily located on move-in day.

Pack ahead.
Anything you can pack ahead will save you time on moving day. If itâ€™s summer, get your winter clothes out of the way. You donâ€™t really need 5 radios or TVâ€™s around your house for the last few days there. Box up your shampoo and extra toothpaste and live out of a travel cosmetic case for the last week or two. Pare down cooking utensils and food supplies to bare essentials. Wastebaskets can also be packed (put things in them!) while you switch to using plastic grocery bags (hang them on a cabinet door or door handle to collect trash.)

Consolidate cleaning supplies.
If you must clean your old place after moving out, put together a kit of basic cleaning supplies and rags. Clean anything possible ahead of time (the inside of kitchen cupboards, the oven, windows, etc.), and if possible, vacuum each room as movers empty it.

Use your luggage.
Fill luggage and duffle bags with clothing, sheets, towels, and paper goods. Even forlocalÂ moves youâ€™ll be able to quickly spot your navy suitcase holding your favorite sweaters, whereas â€œBox #189â€³ might remain elusive for days.

Safeguard valued items.
Itâ€™s a good idea to keepÂ valuable possessions,Â such as silverware, collections, or antiques, with you. If you have a long move and no room in your car, bury the items in a box titled â€œMisc. from kitchen pantryâ€. Either way, check yourÂ homeownerâ€™s insuranceÂ to see how you are covered during the move, and if you need additional insurance from the mover. Also, find out what paperwork (receipts, appraisals, and photos) you might need to file a claim in case of loss.

Keep important papers with you.
Your list of â€œimportantâ€ papers might includeÂ : birth certificates, school records, mover estimates, new job contacts, utility company numbers, recent bank records, current bills, phone lists, closing papers, realtor info, maps, and more. Donâ€™t leave these with the mover. Keep them with you!

Personal boxes.
Use brightly colored storage tote boxes, one for each person. Let each family member fill theirs with items theyâ€™ll want â€˜right awayâ€™ in the new home â€” a set of sheets, a towel, a couple of extension cords, a phone, nightlights, address book, pens and paper, keys, kleenex, and travel cosmetic case, and so on.

Moving may not be the most fun youâ€™ve ever had, but planning ahead will go a long way toward making the process bearable.

item.title: Reviews

item.content:encoded:
[et_pb_section][et_pb_row][et_pb_column type="4_4"][et_pb_text admin_label="Text" background_layout="light" text_orientation="left"]

How to post the following review sites:

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row][et_pb_column type="1_2"][et_pb_text admin_label="Text" background_layout="light" text_orientation="left" use_border_color="on" border_color="#258a43" border_style="solid" border_width="3px" custom_padding="20|20||20"]

Google+

  • Click here to visit our Google+ Local page. The page will display a Reviews section along with several reviews.
  • In the middle column of the page, you'll see a "Review Summary" box.
  • Click "Write a Review." Google will ask if you have a Google account.
    • a. If you have a Gmail account you can use your login info for that account.
    • b. Otherwise click the red "Create an account" button and follow the steps to create your Google account.
  • After you have logged in, Google will return you to our Google+ page. A pop-up box will ask you to rate us and write your review.
  • Google editors will need to approve your review, so it may not appear for a few days.
  • Thank you!
[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text admin_label="Text" background_layout="light" text_orientation="left" use_border_color="on" border_color="#258a43" border_style="solid" border_width="3px" custom_padding="20|20||20"]

City Search

  • Click here to visit our CitySearch page.
  • Click the orange Write a Review button about halfway down the page.
  • CitySearch will ask you to log into a CitySearch Account.
    • If you have a CitySearch or Facebook account, you can use your existing login info.
    • Otherwise fill in the right side of the pop-up window to create an account. Please note that the Member Name you choose will display next to any review you write. Click the Sign Up button at the bottom of the review.
      • CitySearch will send a confirmation message to the email address you used to create your account. Check your email and follow the instructions in the message from CitySearch. Your review may not display until you have followed the instructions in this confirmation message.
      • Return to our CitySearch page and again click the Write a Review button.
      • Write A Review pop-up window will appear above our business listing. Write your review and click Publish.
      • CitySearch editors will need to approve your review, so it may not appear for a few days.
      • Thank you!
      [/et_pb_text][et_pb_text admin_label="Text" background_layout="light" text_orientation="left" use_border_color="on" border_color="#258a43" border_style="solid" border_width="3px" custom_padding="20|20||20"]

      HomeAdvisor

      • Click here to visit our HomeAdvisor page.
      • Click the Write a Review button about halfway down the page.
      • Complete the "overall experience" page and click "next".
      • Finish your review on the next page and hit "submit".
      • A window will popup allowing you to either login using Facebook or Twitter or you can create an account.
      • Once you've completed that step, you'll be able to finalize your review and receive your confirmation email.
      • Thank you!
       
      [/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type="1_2"][et_pb_text admin_label="Text" background_layout="light" text_orientation="left" use_border_color="on" border_color="#258a43" border_style="solid" border_width="3px" custom_padding="20|20||20"]

      Moving Company Reviews

      • Click here to visit our Moving Company Reviews page.
      • Click the Write a Review button towards the bottom of the page.
      • It will will ask you to enter in a copy of your moving receipt because they only post verified customer reviews.
        • If you don't have this handy you can call us at (512) 201-4777 and we'll send you a copy.
        • Otherwise go ahead and upload that and complete the rest of the review.
      • Once you submit, it will send you an email to confirm the review.
      • Moving Company Reviews editors will need to approve your review, so it may not appear for a few days.
      • Thank you!
       
      [/et_pb_text][et_pb_text admin_label="Text" background_layout="light" text_orientation="left" use_border_color="on" border_color="#258a43" border_style="solid" border_width="3px" custom_padding="20|20||20"]

      Yelp

      Note: We love getting reviews on Yelp, but unless you are an active Yelper who has posted reviews of five or more businesses, Yelp will probably filter and hide any review you post. If you are not an active Yelp user, you may want to review us on one of the other sites on this page.

      • Click here to visit our Yelp page. Below our name, address and phone number, you will see a row of buttons including a Write a Review button. Click this.
      • Yelp will ask you to log into a Yelp Account.
        • If you already have a Yelp Account, you can use your existing login info.
        • Otherwise click the Sign Up button and follow the steps to create an account.
        • Return to our Yelp pageÂ again click the Write a Review button
      • Write your review and save it.
      • Thank you!
       
       
      [/et_pb_text][et_pb_text admin_label="Text" background_layout="light" text_orientation="left" use_border_color="on" border_color="#258a43" border_style="solid" border_width="3px" custom_padding="20|20||20"]

      Yellow Pages

      • Click here to visit our Yellow page.
      • Click the Write a Review button near the top of the page, it's right beneath the photo gallery.
      • Simply leave a 1-5 star rating (hopefully 5 stars) and fill in your review
      • When you hit submit a box will popup to login to Facebook or Google+ or you can create an account.
      • Once you've chosen your option, press submit and your review is live.
      • Thank you!
      [/et_pb_text][et_pb_text admin_label="Text" background_layout="light" text_orientation="left" use_border_color="on" border_color="#258a43" border_style="solid" border_width="3px" custom_padding="20|20||20"]

      Movers.com

      • Click here to visit our Movers.com page.
      • Click the blue Write a Review button right in the middle of the page.
      • Click register in the top right corner to create a Movers.com account.
      • Once you've created your account, simply finalize your review and hit submit.
      • Thank you!
      [/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section]

    • Otherwise fill in the right side of the pop-up window to create an account. Please note that the Member Name you choose will display next to any review you write. Click the â€œSign Upâ€ button at the bottom of the review.
      • CitySearch will send a confirmation message to the email address you used to create your account. Check your email and follow the instructions in the message from CitySearch. Your review may not display until you have followed the instructions in this confirmation message.
      • Return to our CitySearch pageÂ and again click the â€œWrite a Reviewâ€ button.
  • A â€œWrite A Reviewâ€ pop-up window will appear above our business listing. Write your review and click â€œPublish.â€
  • CitySearch editors will need to approve your review, so it may not appear for a few days.
  • Thank you!
Â 
Â 

Moving Company Reviews

  • Click here to visit our Moving Company Reviews page.
  • Click the â€œWrite a Reviewâ€ button towards the bottom of the page.
  • It will will ask you to enter in a copy of your moving receipt because they only post verified customer reviews.
    • If you don't have this handy you can call us at (512) 201-4777 and we'll send you a copy.
    • Otherwise go ahead and upload that and complete the rest of the review.
  • Once you submit, it will send you an email to confirm the review.
  • Moving Company Reviews editors will need to approve your review, so it may not appear for a few days.
  • Thank you!
Â 
Â 

HomeAdvisor

  • Click here to visit our HomeAdvisor page.
  • Click the Â â€œWrite a Reviewâ€ button about halfway down the page.
  • Complete the "overall experience" page and click "next".
  • Finish your review on the next page and hit "submit".
  • A window will popup allowing you to either login using Facebook or Twitter or you can create an account.
  • Once you've completed that step, you'll be able to finalize your review and receive your confirmation email.
  • Thank you!
Â 
Â 

Yellow Pages

  • Click here to visit our Yellow page.
  • Click the â€œWrite a Reviewâ€ button near the top of the page, it's right beneath the photo gallery.
  • Simply leave a 1-5 star rating (hopefully 5 stars) and fill in your review
  • When you hit submit a box will popup to login to Facebook or Google+ or you can create an account.
  • Once you've chosen your option, press submit and your review is live.
  • Thank you!
Â 
Â 

Movers.com

  • Click here to visit our Movers.com page.
  • Click the blue â€œWrite a Reviewâ€ button right in the middle of the page.
    • â€‹Click "register" in the top right corner to create a Movers.com account.
  • Once you've created your account, simply finalize your review and hit submit.
  • Thank you!

item.dc:creator: Austin Moving Forward
item.content:encoded:
[et_pb_section admin_label="Section" fullwidth="on" specialty="off" background_image="http://www.austinmovingforward.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/09/moving-company-in-austin-tx-header.jpg" transparent_background="off" background_color="#ffffff" allow_player_pause="off" inner_shadow="off" parallax="off" parallax_method="off" padding_mobile="off" make_fullwidth="off" use_custom_width="off" width_unit="on" make_equal="off" use_custom_gutter="off"][et_pb_fullwidth_code admin_label="Fullwidth Code"]<link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Racing+Sans+One" rel="stylesheet"> <div class="headimage" style="background: url(http://www.austinmovingforward.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/09/pattern.png); height: 400px;"> <span class="bgoverlay"> <h1 class="headtext" style="font-family: 'Racing Sans One', cursive; font-size: 65px; color: white; text-shadow: 2px 3px 4px #000000; padding-top: 100px; text-align: center;"> RELIABLE MOVING COMPANY AUSTIN TX </h1> <p class="ptext" style="font-family: 'Racing Sans One', cursive; font-size: 45px; color: green; text-shadow: 2px 3px 4px #000000; padding-bottom: 100px; text-align: center;"> About Austin Moving Forward </p> </span> </div> </div>[/et_pb_fullwidth_code][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section admin_label="section"][et_pb_row admin_label="row" make_fullwidth="on" use_custom_width="off" width_unit="on" use_custom_gutter="off" custom_padding="0px|0px|30px|0px" padding_mobile="off" allow_player_pause="off" parallax="off" parallax_method="off" make_equal="off" parallax_1="off" parallax_method_1="off" column_padding_mobile="on" parallax_2="off" parallax_method_2="off"][et_pb_column type="1_2"][et_pb_text admin_label="Text" background_layout="light" text_orientation="left" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid" custom_margin="0px|0px|0px|0px" custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px" custom_padding_last_edited="off|" text_font="Arial||||" text_font_size="16" text_line_height="1.5em"]

Reliable Moving Company Austin TX

Your top choice for Moving Companies Austin TX, we are a full service moving company meaning we come out and handle all the moving for you and offer storage services as well.  We are a full service Austin Moving company and we can also store your furnishings in our state-of-the-art storage facility, for as long as you need us to. We are licensed, bonded, and fully insured and our services are handled by our trained and experienced Austin Movers, to ensure a hassle free moving process.  Our team of professional movers, will disassemble and reassemble your larger furniture, pack and unpack, and protect and wrap your fragile items for transport to your new apartment, home, or office. When choosing us as your Moving Company in Austin you get a month free storage, and a worry-free moving process whether it be for local moving, commercial moving, or statewide moving, we got you covered.

We're your best choice when needing a Moving Company Austin TX

Our founder is a busy mother of two who felt it was important that children and future generations grow up in a less toxic world. This is our company's core belief. Therefore we use recycled boxes wrapping paper and plastic, biodegradable packing adhesives and loaner boxes to reduce our carbon footprint. Take a look around, view our customer testimonials on our Austin Movers, print yourself a coupon to show our Austin Movers and get started with your FREE quote today.  We look forward to helping you along your journey across Austin or across the great state of Texas. [/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type="1_2"][et_pb_video admin_label="Video" src="https://youtu.be/K2NqxWbm7iw"] [/et_pb_video][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row admin_label="row" make_fullwidth="on" use_custom_width="off" width_unit="on" use_custom_gutter="off" custom_padding="0px||0px|" padding_mobile="off" custom_margin="0px||0px|" allow_player_pause="off" parallax="off" parallax_method="off" make_equal="off" parallax_1="off" parallax_method_1="off" padding_top_1="0px" padding_bottom_1="0px" column_padding_mobile="on"][et_pb_column type="4_4"][et_pb_divider admin_label="Divider" color="#258a43" show_divider="on"] [/et_pb_divider][et_pb_text admin_label="Text" background_layout="light" text_orientation="left" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid"]

Common Questions When Looking for a Moving Company Austin TX

Q: How much does it cost to move? A: It depends on a lot of factors, but our average move was $1,500 - $2,000 last year. See Average Moving Costs for ballpark estimates, or if you would like a more accurate estimate call us at 512.201.4777. Q: Do I need to pack everything or what do I need to pack to prepare for the movers? A: If it is smaller than a breadbox, then put it in a box. Remember, you are paying your movers by the hour, and it takes us a lot less time to dolly out boxes than to carry out miscellaneous items and find safe places on the truck for it. In fact, our movers are trained to refuse to take certain items if not properly packed. Q: Does Austin Moving Forward provide packing services? A: Yes. You can hire Austin Moving Forward to pack every room in your house or just your kitchen. You pick the level of service that you want for your residential move. Q: How much does it cost to pack my house? A: Probably less than you think. The average cost to pack a 2 bedroom apartment is approximately $300. See Average Moving Costs for ballpark estimates, or if you would like a more accurate residential moving estimate call us at 512.201.4777. [caption id="attachment_328" align="alignleft" width="300"] Austin Moving Forward an supply you with boxes, tape, etc.[/caption] Q: Where do I get moving boxes? A: Some people try and collect miscellaneous boxes before they move. However we have a Buy-Back Program you can take advantage of. Using uniform sized moving boxes helps the movers load the truck quicker, and since we get paid by the hour, using good boxes can save you money. Q: Does Austin Moving Foward sell moving boxes? A: Yes. We carry a complete line of boxes and moving supplies and we offer free delivery if you are moving with us. Take a look at our Box Buy-Back Program. Q: Do I need to empty the clothes out of my dresser drawers? A: No. There is no need to use the extra boxes. Our movers can handle the extra weight. However, you will need to remove any loose items in the drawers, like papers, change or jewelry. Q: What do I do with the clothes in my closet? A: We rent a specialty box called a wardrobe box. Take a look at our Buy-Back Program. Q: What can I do to save money on my move? A: The biggest thing you can do to save money is to be prepared for the movers. Have everything packed up and ready to go. Stack boxes 4 high (to easily load on dolly) in the living room or garage and allow movers to put them all in one room at the unload. Disassemble beds, take mirrors off of dressers, and basically prepare all furniture to be moved. Be available to answer the movers questions regarding furniture placement. Don't plan anything else for moving day. Q: Are you insured? What happens if you break a piece of my furniture? A: Yes we are insured. In the event of damage, we will repair your furniture if at all possible. If the damaged piece is not repairable, we will pay the depreciated value of the damaged piece. Q: Are all of your movers full time employees with experience? A: Yes. Many of our movers have been with us for years and our new hire criteria include professional moving experience. We are also committed to continuous training for our employees. Q: How do I know you're not one of those unscrupulous residential moving companies that you see on the news that quote one price and then charge another, or damages furniture and doesn't fix it? A: Austin Moving Forward is fully licensed and insured. We also have a massive collection of great testimonials from many of our satisfied customers. To read your consumer rights and responsibilities, look up important information about our company, or research any moving company go to protectyourmove.gov Still have questions? Contact us today at 512.201.4777 or send us an email. Austin Moving Forward has the answers for all your residential moving questions.

item.title: Buy Back Program
item.dc:creator: Austin Moving Forward
item.content:encoded:
[et_pb_section admin_label="section"][et_pb_row admin_label="row"][et_pb_column type="2_3"][et_pb_text admin_label="Text" background_layout="light" text_orientation="left"]

Buy-Back Program

Austin Moving  Forward strives to be as eco-friendly as possible. This is why we offer a friendly service called our Box Buy-Back Program. You leave us a deposit in the amount of the cost of the boxes. This deposit is refundable at half the cost of what you paid, so long as we get the boxes back in re-usable condition within two weeks after your delivery date. You can keep as many as you like, but you won't get money back for the ones you keep. After you unpack the boxes they must be returned to our location during business hours, folded flat. We then re-use those boxes! Eventually, when the boxes are no longer usable, we recycle them. The Box Buy Back Program is for customers in the Austin Metro area only.  

Moving Supplies Included in our Buy-Back Program

  • Small, Medium and Large boxes
  • Wardrobe boxes
  • Picture/mirror boxes
  • Dish pack boxes

Our team of professional commercial movers will move your office in a timely fashion and avoid any real disruption to your daily operations. We understand that your business is unique, and we take the time and effort to understand any special needs your equipment has. Our goal is to make sure your business is taken care of and gets up and running in its new space quickly. Austin Moving Forward is your premier commercial moving company in Austin. Residential Moves

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row admin_label="row"][et_pb_column type="1_2"][et_pb_text admin_label="Text" background_layout="light" text_orientation="left" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid"] We help with:
  • packing your belongings (and specialized crates)
  • supplies for do-it-yourself packing
  • moving large and heavy furniture
  • delivering your belongings locally
  • Texas statewide moves
  • state-of-the-art storage
  Let us take the load off your back and set up an appointment today! [/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type="1_2"][et_pb_text admin_label="Text" background_layout="light" text_orientation="left" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid"] We all reach a point in life when it's time to make a change. Your family has expanded, you've accumulated possessions, and your well-loved home now seems a little crowded. Whether you're moving into your first house, upsizing to a bigger space, or downsizing, it's time to make a move in life. Residential moving is time-consuming and physically straining. Try and tackle the problem without a plan, and you'll wind up with a headache and thrown back. Squeeze this move into a busy and hectic schedule full of other responsibilities, and it's downright stressful. That's where we come in. Our team of experienced professional residential movers will take care of your belongings.  We'll treat them like they're our own! We can take care of you every step of the moving process, and help make this a comfortable, exciting moving experience. We strive to be your first choice for residential moving in Austin. item.title: Privacy Policy
item.dc:creator: Austin Moving Forward
item.content:encoded:
[et_pb_section][et_pb_row][et_pb_column type="4_4"][et_pb_text admin_label="Text" background_layout="light" text_orientation="left"]

Privacy Policy

What information do we collect? When submit a quote or contact us form on our site, as appropriate, you may be asked to enter your: Name E-mail address Mailing address Phone number What do we use your information for? Any of the information we collect from you may be used in one of the following ways: â€¢ To personalize your experience Â (your information helps us to better respond to your individual needs) â€¢ Your information, whether public or private, will not be sold, exchanged, transferred, or given to any other company for any reason whatsoever, without your consent, other than for the express purpose of delivering the purchased product or service requested. â€¢ To send periodic emails Do we disclose any information to outside parties? â€¢ We do not sell, trade, or otherwise transfer to outside parties your personally identifiable information. This does not include trusted third parties who assist us in operating our website, conducting our business, or servicing you, so long as those parties agree to keep this information confidential. We may also release your information when we believe release is appropriate to comply with the law, enforce our site policies, or protect ours or others rights, property, or safety. However, non-personally identifiable visitor information may be provided to other parties for marketing, advertising, or other uses. By using our site, you consent to our privacy policy. If we decide to change our privacy policy, we will post those changes on this page, and/or update the Privacy Policy modification date below. Â This policy was last modified onÂ 5/29/2015. Contacting Us If there are any questions regarding this privacy policy you may contact us using the information below. Austin Moving Forward 9201 Brown Lane #191 Austin, TX 78754   info@austinmovingforward.com 512.201.4777 [/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section]

item.title: Thank You
item.dc:creator: Austin Moving Forward
item.content:encoded:
Thank you for submitting an online quote request!

Your information has been saved in our system and will be handled by one of our professional relocation advisor, who will be contacting you shortly.

If you have any questions or would like to speak now to one of our advisors please call Austin Moving Forward at 512-201-4777. Please have your order number available when you call. If you have any comments we welcome you to write them in the remarks section.

Thank you again, we look forward to assisting you with your move.

For special offers or moving tips visit our Website http://www.austinmovingforward.com

Welcome to Austin Moving Forward, Austin’s best eco-friendly moving company!  We believe that is it possible to combine first class service with the utmost sincerity, and can do it all at affordable prices, without harming the environment.
